title: Use and treatment of Confidential Information

paragraphs.content: The Receiving Party shall take reasonable measures to protect the secrecy of and avoid disclosure and unauthorized use of the Confidential Information. Without limiting the foregoing, the Receiving Party shall take at least those measures it employs to protect its own most highly confidential information.

The Receiving Party shall not make any copies of the Confidential Information in any form except as required to accomplish the Permitted Purpose. Any copies of Confidential Information shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party, or, where applicable, the relevant group member of the Disclosing Party that owns such information. The Receiving Party shall reproduce all proprietary rights notices on any such authorized copies, in the same manner in which such notices were set forth in or on the original.
The Receiving Party shall immediately notify the Disclosing Party of any unauthorized use or disclosure, or suspected unauthorized use or disclosure, of Confidential Information.
